text:
Raskolnikov left the room feeling more confident than ever. He muttered to himself, “Now we’ll make a fight for it,” with a smirk. But that smirk was really aimed at his own cowardice. He felt shame and contempt as he remembered how he had backed down. 

The next morning hit Pyotr Petrovitch hard. After that awkward talk with Dounia and her mom, he was forced to face some harsh truths. What seemed wild and unbelievable just yesterday was now his reality. The sting of hurt pride had been eating at him all night. When he finally got out of bed, he checked himself out in the mirror.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov leaves the room feeling more confident and maliciously self-reflective about his cowardice.
